attributes.additional_details:
Currently, single people on a cruise or package holiday are charged a supplement for sole occupation of a cabin/bedroom.   It is a huge deterrent, as well as thoroughly discriminatory, for single people to have to pay anything up to 76% pp more of the listed fare for their accommodation.
I would like the Government to litigate for all holiday accommodation to be based on single occupancy, so that additional occupants pay extra - say 75%.
